release.action: Naming of ConsoleAppender categories in IE fixed.

section.title: Consolidated Version
section.p: Only bugs reported for 1.0-RC1 are fixed within this release.

release.action: Prototype overwrites refactored to Log4js-methods.
AjaxAppender does not XML-quote referer.
XSD added to project for sending XML-Messages. DTD set to depricate.

section.title: Improved Version
section.p: Many changes are done since last release. Have a look on the action list.

The biggest change is the change of API to have Appender and Layout classes more object oriented and be part of Log4js object. For example instead of new ConsoleAppender() use now new Log4js.ConsoleAppender().

release.action: FileAppender supports now also Mozilla Browser. Many thanks for this patch to Nicolas Justin and Gregory Kokanosky of http://www.idealx.com
ConsoleAppender supports now several Loggers with several Console.
ConsoleAppender can set specific accesskey now.
Now generating also gzipped TAR archive. Directory log4js-[version] added in the archive.
FAQs extended.
AJAXappender fixed for sending several log entries in respect of response delay.
Wiki created for improved community.
Unit tests on basis of jsTester added.
PatternLayout implemented and first compatibility alignments to log4javascript.
Users Guide created and published.
Log4js refactored to be more object oriented. Also new hierarchical structure introduced for appenders and layouts to be part of Log4js object.
Log4js-servlet created to handle AJAX send logging events on server using Log4j or Java Logging.
Refactored structure of the project.
Layout added to support different layouts of logging output.
SimpleLayout and BasicLayout as first implementation of Layouts added.
HtmlLayout implemented.
XMLLayout implemented.
JavaScript Lint added to ant target and warnings corrected in scripts.
MozJSConsoleAppender created. It logs to the JavaScript console of Mozilla browsers.
OperaJSConsoleAppender created. It logs to the JavaScript console of Opera browser.
SafariJSConsoleAppender created. It logs to the JavaScript console of Safari browser. Who could test this?
AjaxAppender supports now threshold for sending events in groups.
Initial installation of website at http://log4js.berlios.de
Project setup at http://developer.berlios.de/projects/log4js/ and initial checkin at SVN.
Changed the way log levels are modeled to mirror Log4j conventions.
Change Log4js.LogLevel to Log4js.Level (Log4j has a LogLevel class and a Level class, LogLevel is actually part of the LogFactor5 3rd party package) to match Log4j naming conventions
Created static objects representing each log level.
Added OFF and ALL levels to mirror Log4j levels.
JSONLayout implemented to support exchange of data by JSON
Renamed Log4js.LogEntry to Log4js.LoggingEvent to mirror Log4j naming conventions.
JSAlertAppender added. Thanks to Sébastien LECACHEUR.
DefaultAppender renamed to Appender to reflect it as "Interface" for other appenders.
JSDoc added to build and comments updated to JSDoc.
ANT build.xml created for build processes.
Forrest capabilities added to generate web site doumentation
Combined HtmlConsoleAppender and WindowAppender into a single appender since they are really the same thing (a console) just in different locations
New appender is called ConsoleAppender, you indicate whether the console should run inline during construction (default is to launch in new window)

Created an Log4js.LogEntry object to model a log entry, has category, level, and message properties, it has a method to return a formatted string representing the message (need to replace this with actual Layouts).
Logs entries stored in central log entry array
Appenders are notified of new log entries through event notificiation and use of Log4js.Event objects
When a new log entry appears all appenders automatically notified.
When log entries are cleared all appenders are notified and cleared.

Added HtmlConsoleAppender that writes log messages to a hidden "console" that can be toggled with "Alt-d". Thanks to Corey Johnson whose Lumberjack (http://gleepglop.com/javascripts/logger/) code was adapted for this appender.
Pulled LogLevel and Logger under a main "class" called Log4js, updated all documentation an test functions to reflect changes.
Fixed "clear" and "close" buttons on WindowAppender.
Fixed scrolling issues in WindowAppender.
Fixed IE javascript bug if user chooses "no" on ActiveX dialogue.
Updated all tests and comments to reflect above changes.
AJAXAppender
First version published.

actions.action: Add PatternLayout capability like log4j (http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/api/org/apache/log4j/PatternLayout.html). Probably RegEx required, infos see: http://www.regular-expressions.info/javascript.html.
Implement log4js.properties feature to configure log4js at central place. Probably the properties-file has to be located at {web-root}/js/log4js.properties?
Matrix of supported browsers/environments required. Probably someone could help on non-Windows platforms?
